result.execSummary:
The defendant Ingram W Broome was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ingram W Broome is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ingram W Broome was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Payment Plan $50/mo beginning 09-01-16 + $15 PPF
Cash Bond to be applied.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ingram W Broome

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to Ingram W Broome regarding NSF payment

Defendant Ingram W Broome in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Atty Gumz agrees and states that there is a cash bond on file and the defendant would ask for a payment plan for the balance.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Pay fine and costs = $379.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Cash bond to be applied
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan for the balance:  $50.00/month commencing on September 1, 2016

Ct. 2 to be dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz spoke with his client this morning and on his way here his car broke down.  Atty Gumz states that he is between Green Lake and Princeton.  

BY THE COURT:  Reset to 1:45pm today.

BACK ON THE RECORD:
Atty Gumz states that he has not had time today to follow-up with the defendant however, he did not appear at the courthouse today.  Atty Gumz asks for a reset.

BY THE COURT:  Court will reset one time.
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Ingram W Broome in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant is hoping to to get a valid DL and asks that this matter be brought back in May.  Defendant is a full time student and is not working right now.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea/Sentencing.
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Ingram W Broome in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz received discovery and an offer from DA.  Requests 1 additional time to return to court as defendant has a few questions.
BY THE COURT:  Reset.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ingram W Broome in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant was going to get an Attorney at the last hearing.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant states that he has contacted the PD office but has not heard anything back.  
Court will adjourn for 10 minutes to give the defendant time to speak with Atty Gumz.

BY THE COURT:  Court will reset one time.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Ingram W Broome in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Court finds probable cause.
  
BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant wants to get an Attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

citations.chargeDescr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
